result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

***ALSO $20,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim C.T (person, property, residence or family). Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Not to hold employment at adult family care homes.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED:  4-11-2022:  Bond modified to allow 2 hours per day, 7 days a week to attend to personal needs and errands.  Also allowed to take mother to verified doctor's appointments.  Provide doctor's note to RCAP after leaving the appointment. No contact with group home.  No contact with the victim.

2:00PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donny Lee Jones in court. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  This is on the court's calendar today based upon the defendant requesting to represent himself at his last hearing in front of the Court Commissioner.  Defendant makes statement. The defendant is eligible for SPD, SPD has made 517 contacts to appoint counsel.  The Court asks the defendant if he would like to have the court consider a County appointment.  BTC: County atty appointed, Repayment set at $10/month, court will set a start date when an atty is appointed.  Court will review the entire payment at the conclusion of this case. BTC: Finding of good cause to waive time limits continued.
Defendant requests the GPS, house arrest be removed.  Defendant makes further statement.  The State does not object to exceptions to GPS.  The State does object to removal.  BTC: Bond modified to allow 2 hours per day, 7 days a week to attend to personal needs and errands.  Also allowed to take mother to verified doctor's appointments.  Provide doctor's note to RCAP after leaving the appointment. No contact with group home.
